awd_titl_txt: Acquisition of Alexandrite Laser for Nonlinear Optical      Materials Research
awd_abstract_narration: Funds are provided for the purchase an Alexandrite laser for  nonlinear optical (NLO) materials research. The University is  following a long-term plan to significantly upgrade its Laser/NLO  Research Laboratory to support research activities in two areas  (i) characterization of the third-order susceptibility of highly  photorefractive NLO materials of interest for optical switching,  optical computing, and optical power limiting applications; and  (2) research into the properties Of gamma-irradiated color  centers and impurity doped crystals of interest for spectrally  tunable solid-state lasers, passive Q-switches, and mode-lockers.  The currently available lasers are limited to certain fixed  wavelengths and temporal pulse shapes. A laser source with a  variable wavelength and temporal pulse width is a necessity for  NLO materials research being performed in this laboratory. The  instrument also is useful for enhancing the education of the  undergraduate and graduates students who participate in the  laboratory.
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Mathematical and Physical Sciences
